intro: Cupaniopsis flaccida, commonly known as the flaccid cupaniopsis, is a shrub native to Australia. It belongs to the family Euphorbiaceae and is characterized by its small, green, fleshy leaves. The plant produces yellowish flowers that are clustered in inflorescences, and it is adapted to arid and semi-arid environments. It is often found in coastal regions and is known for its ability to tolerate saline soils. The species is of interest in ecological studies due to its resilience and unique botanical features.
